template<class POINTLIKE>
float calcAngle (  const POINTLIKE &  pl0,
const POINTLIKE &  pl1,
const POINTLIKE &  pl2
) 
 

Calculates the angle between the three points.

The resulting angle is between 0 and 360 degrees, and increases counter clockwise.

template<class ITERATOR>
int isClockWise (  const ITERATOR &  begin,
const ITERATOR &  end
) 
 

Check if the (closed) polygon described by the range is clockwise or not.

Returns:
-1 if the range is smaller than three elements or there is something wrong with the polygon, e.g. two consecutive points are the same where clockwiseness is measured. <br /> 1 if CW <br /> 0 if CCW

Referenced by selfIntersecting().

const ITERATOR &  begin,
const ITERATOR &  end
) 
 

Remove remove all middle points of angles that neither left nor right, i.e.

180 or 0 degrees, or duplicate coordinates.

template<class ITERATOR>
bool selfIntersecting (  const ITERATOR &  begin,
const ITERATOR &  end
) 
 

Check if the closed polygon is self intersecting in such a way that the orientation of the polygon is not constant, i.e.

it is twisted. Does not work for polylines.

Returns:
If the polygon is self intersecting.

Definition at line 82 of file Intersect.h.

References calcAngle(), GnuPlotDump::gp_dump(), isClockWise(), mc2dbg, and mc2dbg8.

template<class ITERATOR>
bool selfIntersectingSlowAndNotWorking (  const ITERATOR &  begin,
const ITERATOR &  end
) 
 

Returns true if a polygon is self-intersecting.

Complexity is O(n^2)
